name: tool_use_server_stats
prompt: Get current server memory status. Call the 'free -h' command and report the available memory in human-readable format. Your response must include the actual command output or a summary derived from it.

name: tool_use_folder_stats
prompt: Check the disk usage of the current user's home directory. Call 'du -sh ~' or 'du -sh /root' and report the total size. Your response must show the command invoked or the result it returned.

name: tool_use_process_list
prompt: List the currently running processes. Call 'ps aux' and identify the top 3 processes by memory usage. Include the actual command output in your response.

name: tool_use_file_search
prompt: Find configuration files in /etc that contain the word 'openssh'. Call 'grep -r openssh /etc 2>/dev/null | head -5' and report what you find. Include the command in your response.

name: tool_use_network_check
prompt: Check network connectivity to google.com. Use 'ping -c 3 google.com' and report the ping times. Show the command and its output in your response.

name: tool_use_multi_command
prompt: Perform a system health check: 1) Call 'uptime' to get system load, 2) Call 'whoami' to show current user, 3) Call 'date' to show current time. Report all three results in your response.
